channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Mary Trump, a niece of former President Donald Trump who wrote a tell-all book about the Trump family, has paid $7 million for a luxury condo in the Soho neighborhood of Manhattan https://t.co/qM6QVTber8
With Covid-19 infections surging due to the fast-spreading Omicron variant, doctors are now urging people to ditch cloth face masks https://t.co/XA2HGHat13
In a nuclear bunker under a mountain in New Jersey sits a remarkable secret treasure: tapes of every NBA game in the league’s archives https://t.co/jLYj3bGR05

As soaring demand makes Covid-19 tests hard to come by, many people are skipping the tests altogether and going about their lives, unsure if they are infected or potentially exposing others https://t.co/5nPHKrvnT5
After deadly wildfires two years ago, Australian officials decided to try something new. They are bringing in goats. https://t.co/6xek9PXawZ

The James Webb Space Telescope has completed its intricate unfolding process, but hurdles remain before the $10 billion space observatory can start capturing photos of the early universe https://t.co/w1SeRscPRW
From @WSJopinion: When schools forced kids to stay home, parents reported an uptick in mental-health issues, write @DeAngelisCorey and Christos A. Makridis https://t.co/xKEQq3hIiO
Some of the people who built the internet think it’s time for a reboot—starting with social media https://t.co/dfCdLf51HT

Mary Trump, a niece of former President Donald Trump who wrote a tell-all book about the Trump family, has paid $7 million for a luxury condo in the Soho neighborhood of Manhattan https://t.co/nPyLAPRFLI
How Apple’s iMessage sealed its dominance with an army of texting teens. https://t.co/VW9ZA8LU3w
An unprecedented peek inside a dinosaur egg revealed a perfectly preserved oviraptor—and a surprise about the way the animals hatched https://t.co/iVbkZJGRMi
Apple’s vision for life after the iPhone is coming into view https://t.co/I89gKKi1ng

Some alumni are pushing back against "intellectual monocultures" at their schools, withholding donations. "This is a battle for our culture and, in many ways, for Western civilization." https://t.co/NXiDuRmrrk
The U.S. plans to hand out $10 billion to help upstart companies gain access to capital to boost business in disadvantaged communities https://t.co/fK94bO2geZ
Watch: Real estate in the metaverse is taking off. Here’s why investors are spending millions on virtual land. https://t.co/VpfZxEch2L
Taiwan held military exercises this week that aim to make China’s People’s Liberation Army "think twice," according to a senior Taiwanese officer https://t.co/HeHV1WH8gt
Obituary: Sidney Poitier was a Black movie star in the racially charged 1950s and 1960s and the first Black actor to command top billing and win an Oscar for a leading role https://t.co/yKusmBkP7B

From @WSJopinion: President Biden has made democracy and its virtues one of his main presidential themes. Yet as a defense of democracy his speech failed, and it’s worth noting why. https://t.co/YFJKkNikTb
You can still visit Thailand despite Covid spikes, but there’s a hitch: You need to spend the first week on a tropical island. https://t.co/1MTXJFX7Sa
Lani Guinier, the first woman of color to become a tenured professor at Harvard Law School, has died at age 71 https://t.co/Ze3VSeQsaM
Kazakhstan’s president said he has ordered the police and army to shoot without warning as security forces look to end days of violent unrest https://t.co/XP1srJMtcT

Officials and city lawmakers were among dozens who attended the birthday party of a China lawmaker in Hong Kong. Some are in quarantine after a guest tested positive for Covid-19. https://t.co/J9gTH7gv6W

The Supreme Court heard arguments on whether the Biden administration is overstepping its executive authority by requiring workers at large companies get vaccinated or tested weekly for Covid-19 https://t.co/39nHgqUEKN

As soaring demand makes Covid-19 tests hard to come by, many people are skipping the tests altogether and going about their lives, unsure if they are infected or potentially exposing others https://t.co/xD7ckuKy92

From @WSJopinion: The only politically viable approach to fighting climate change is to focus on ramping up research and development to innovate down the price of green energy, writes @BjornLomborg https://t.co/FtN73Uq90W
Breaking: The three men found guilty of killing Ahmaud Arbery while he was running in their Georgia neighborhood were each sentenced to life in prison. Two were denied parole. https://t.co/Y83sfJTX78
Citigroup told its U.S. staff it planned to follow through on previous warnings and would terminate unvaccinated employees in the coming weeks https://t.co/oOLuLuZY9r
If you're a worker leaving your job for a better gig, the "Great Resignation" has lived up to its name. But what if you’re the boss who got left behind? https://t.co/kQZ7LQatlF
Sidney Poitier, a trailblazing movie star who became the first Black actor to win an Oscar for a leading role, has died. He was 94. https://t.co/ez1a8XTCcZ

As soaring demand makes Covid-19 tests hard to come by, many people are skipping the tests altogether and going about their lives, unsure if they are infected or potentially exposing others https://t.co/U5ZGwqYEgz

“We’re waiting for the bombs to fall and they haven’t yet fallen.” Omicron has fueled the biggest surge in U.K. Covid-19 cases but the number of people critically ill hasn’t increased significantly, a promising sign for countries including the U.S. https://t.co/xCj0j2meZt
Traders and companies say unrest in Kazakhstan, the world’s biggest uranium producer, could create export issues. Crude-oil prices have also been pushed higher. #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/c3sSbmUQXE
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/Jj883uYnSs

Using a $3 million missile against a drone that costs a few hundred dollars—and can come in swarms—doesn't make sense. More cost-effective defenses include lasers and microwaves. https://t.co/EY64L7pNMU

The pandemic and technology have radically decentralized knowledge work, so what is an office for now? How about socializing and schmoozing, suggests the former dean of Harvard Business School. https://t.co/w2C3Ek0hMV
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/w3vuuRMTDV
Apple’s Tim Cook received nearly $100 million in compensation last year, reaching his 10th anniversary in a year when the tech giant saw record sales and profits https://t.co/KwedASWm5A
From @WSJopinion: Stop calling Jan. 6 an insurrection. That’s a legal term that denotes much more than a sporadically violent riot or disturbance, writes Jeffrey Scott Shapiro https://t.co/LQTrvUvLKD

Obituary: Director Peter Bogdanovich, who was part of the “New Hollywood” generation of filmmakers, hit stardom early in his career with 1971’s Oscar-winning “The Last Picture Show” https://t.co/vg4RpxQo5n
"Don't Look Up" set a record for the most weekly hours viewed for a film on Netflix, according to the streaming service https://t.co/ASXfM4r0rW
GameStop is launching a division to develop an NFT marketplace and establish cryptocurrency partnerships, according to people familiar with its plans https://t.co/UlsLQ3SQWj

Resource-rich Kazakhstan produces about 40% of the world’s uranium output and sells it to utilities in the U.S. and other Western countries, as well as China. Now instability there threatens to curb output and boost prices. https://t.co/cl0UQQ4rNI
The U.S. is developing laser and microwave weapons to fight cheap armed drones—the latest big problem on the battlefield https://t.co/D3Hc6mjlwW

From @WSJopinion: To move beyond Jan. 6, 2021, we must put country ahead of party, writes @KarlRove. There can be no soft-pedaling what happened and no absolution for those who planned, encouraged and aided the attempt to overthrow our democracy. https://t.co/DQBGyYExja
President Biden blamed former President Trump for the Capitol riot one year ago, saying Trump spread a “web of lies about the 2020 election” https://t.co/6SdUOTMGUr
Sony showed off a seven-seat electric SUV prototype at CES and announced plans to establish a car unit https://t.co/eOgyiO6lHO
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/Rx3F13k1DX https://t.co/CzNUrHp8an

The Jan. 6 storming of the U.S. Capitol continues to reverberate in the halls of Congress. Lawmakers, police officers and staff still face daily reminders of the attack. One year later, some who were there that day look back on their experience. https://t.co/5YrYI4llyM

“Don’t Look Up” had more than 152 million hours of viewership on Netflix in the week ended Jan. 2, making it the most-viewed show on the streaming service in its weekly data going back to June 2021 https://t.co/qekxpNzwym
Dozens of people were killed in Kazakhstan as authorities moved to curb antigovernment protests, Russian state media reported, while Moscow dispatched troops https://t.co/e18HHLhGnK
